page.title: 09CUSTOMS(1)
page.content: On the Friday evening following the Spring Holiday {Dover's Hill}is the scene of the Games. The hill is a natural arena and the first games were held on them in 1644. There are fireworks and a torchlight procession down Dyer's Lane to Campden Square and dancing. The next day is{Scuttlebrook {Wake.}A fun fair with sideshows fills the street at Leysbourne. In the afternoon a fancy dress parade starts from Littleworth.It is preceded by the Scuttlebrook Queen-elect on a decorated float drawn by the Morris men. The band leads them to the Square. There the queen is crowned, prizes are awarded, Campden Morris dance their traditional dances followed by the schoolchildren with country dances and the Maypole. At the end of the ceremony with the children chafing to be off, the fair opens.
